title: The unfortunate reality for Unai Emery and Arsenal is that old failings still linger
text:
The first corner of the match was greeted with a clenched fist. Not by Sheffield United, who had won it thanks to an admirably adventurous start, but by Unai Emery. The Arsenal head coach was making a clear gesture to his players: be strong, be tough, stand tall.

On that occasion, after just a few minutes of action, they did so. The ball was cleared, Arsenal survived. Around half an hour later, though, the response to another left-wing corner was far less resolute and far more of what we have come to expect from Arsenal in these types of matches. Jack O’Connell was allowed to head the ball down, Lys Mousset was allowed to prod it into the net. It was hard to tell what was more galling for the...
description: The first corner of the match was greeted with a clenched fist.
